job.title: Site Reliability Engineer
job.description:
Site Reliability Engineer
Our client is looking to hire a Site Reliability Engineer to join their team! The SRE will configure, tune, and troubleshoot multi-tiered systems to achieve optimal application performance, stability and availability. In this role, this person will work closely with the software engineers, infrastructure, and network engineers to deploy and maintain our services. This position is fully remote but
candidates must be able to work PST hours.
Additionally, candidates for this role
must be eligible to work W2 (we are unable to work C2C at this time).
The Right Candidate For This Role Will
Have a hands-on, get the job done, attitude.
Be a self-starter who can troubleshoot from start to finish with minimal supervision.
Have the flexibility to deal with rapidly changing needs
Be able to balance multiple projects and assignments.
Requirements
5+ years of experience as an SRE in a large, fast-paced production environment
Must have at least 3 years of experience building and managing AWS infrastructure using Terraform
Must be able to demonstrate deep knowledge of the following AWS Managed Services: EKS, ECS, MSK
Must have strong Python skills (the ability to write simple, and complex automation scripts from scratch as well as modify existing ones).
Must have excellent troubleshooting skills
Must have excellent communication skills and be able to work cross-functionally
Plus Skills
Experience with Kubernetes (will help with troubleshooting)
Understanding of the Linux and system administration at a large scale
Day-To-Day
The primary function of the role is 70% or more:
Supporting the health of the production systems:
Daily, looking at all the monitoring dashboards to see if there are any problems that need to be taken care of and then prioritizing those
As needed, monitoring the infrastructure issues Slack channel from the engineering group and communicate with that team to further understand the problem and resolve it
The secondary function of the role is 30% or less:
Working on sprint board tasks – Example: Someone comes across a problem, and they currently aren’t monitoring for that. So, the task on the sprint board is “Create a new monitoring system” --- This person would then develop scripts used for environment monitoring and task automation using Python
